lead_paragraph: New York City scaled back its extensive security around the United Nations on Monday, lifting a ban on car and truck traffic that had been in place since Sept. 11 along part of First Avenue. A similar scaling back of checkpoints is occurring at other locations, where, nearly four months after the terrorist attacks, security provisions have been re-evaluated in Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly's effort to raise the number of officers assigned to fighting crime.

headline.main: Traffic Ban Around the United Nations Is Lifted
